verses.text:
Samuel also said unto Saul , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent me to anoint thee \add to be\add* king over his people , over Israel : now therefore hearken thou unto the voice of the words of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , I remember \add that\add* which Amalek did to Israel , how he laid \add wait\add* for him in the way , when he came up from Egypt.
Now go and smite Amalek , and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman , infant and suckling , ox and sheep , camel and ass.
And Saul gathered the people together , and numbered them in Telaim , two hundred thousand footmen , and ten thousand men of Judah.
And Saul came to a city of Amalek , and laid wait in the valley.\f + \fr 15.5 \ft laid…: or, fought\f* \p

¶ And Saul said unto the Kenites , Go , depart , get you down from among the Amalekites , lest I destroy you with them: for ye shewed kindness to all the children of Israel , when they came up out of Egypt. So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.
And Saul smote the Amalekites from Havilah \add until\add* thou comest to Shur , that \add is\add* over against Egypt.
And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive , and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.

But Saul and the people spared Agag , and the best of the sheep , and of the oxen , and of the fatlings , and the lambs , and all \add that was\add* good , and would not utterly destroy them: but every thing \add that was\add* vile and refuse , that they destroyed utterly.\f + \fr 15.9 \ft fatlings: or, second sort\f* \p
¶ Then came the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto Samuel , saying ,

It repenteth me that I have set up Saul \add to be\add* king : for he is turned back from following me, and hath not performed my commandments. And it grieved Samuel ; and he cried unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* all night.

And when Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning , it was told Samuel , saying , Saul came to Carmel , and, behold, he set him up a place , and is gone about , and passed on , and gone down to Gilgal.

And Samuel came to Saul : and Saul said unto him, Blessed \add be\add* thou of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: I have performed the commandment of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
And Samuel said , What \add meaneth\add* then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears , and the lowing of the oxen which I hear ?

And Saul said , They have brought them from the Amalekites : for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen , to sacrifice unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God ; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.
Then Samuel said unto Saul , Stay , and I will tell thee what the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath said to me this night. And he said unto him, Say on.

And Samuel said , When thou \add wast\add* little in thine own sight , \add wast\add* thou not \add made\add* the head of the tribes of Israel , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* anointed thee king over Israel ?

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent thee on a journey , and said , Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites , and fight against them until they be consumed.\f + \fr 15.18 \ft they…: Heb. they consume them\f*

Wherefore then didst thou not obey the voice of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, but didst fly upon the spoil , and didst evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*?

And Saul said unto Samuel , Yea, I have obeyed the voice of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and have gone the way which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek , and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.
But the people took of the spoil , sheep and oxen , the chief of the things which should have been utterly destroyed , to sacrifice unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God in Gilgal.

And Samuel said , Hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add as great\add* delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices , as in obeying the voice of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*? Behold, to obey \add is\add* better than sacrifice , \add and\add* to hearken than the fat of rams.

For rebellion \add is as\add* the sin of witchcraft , and stubbornness \add is as\add* iniquity and idolatry. Because thou hast rejected the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, he hath also rejected thee from \add being\add* king.\f + \fr 15.23 \ft witchcraft: Heb. divination\f* \p
¶ And Saul said unto Samuel , I have sinned : for I have transgressed the commandment of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and thy words : because I feared the people , and obeyed their voice.
Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin , and turn again with me, that I may worship the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And Samuel said unto Saul , I will not return with thee: for thou hast rejected the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.
And as Samuel turned about to go away , he laid hold upon the skirt of his mantle , and it rent.
And Samuel said unto him, The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day , and hath given it to a neighbour of thine, \add that is\add* better than thou.
And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent : for he \add is\add* not a man , that he should repent.\f + \fr 15.29 \ft Strength: or, Eternity, or, Victory\f*

Then he said , I have sinned : \add yet\add* honour me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people , and before Israel , and turn again with me, that I may worship the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God.
So Samuel turned again after Saul ; and Saul worshipped the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Then said Samuel , Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites. And Agag came unto him delicately. And Agag said , Surely the bitterness of death is past.
And Samuel said , As thy sword hath made women childless , so shall thy mother be childless among women. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in Gilgal. \p
¶ Then Samuel went to Ramah ; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.
And Samuel came no more to see Saul until the day of his death : nevertheless Samuel mourned for Saul : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* repented that he had made Saul king over Israel.
